name: Full Sit Outs
how_to_perform:
1. Begin in a high plank position, with your hands placed firmly on the ground, shoulder-width apart, and your feet hip-width apart.
2. Engage your core to keep your back straight and body stable.
3. Lift your left hand off the ground while pivoting on your right foot.
4. As you pivot, bring your left leg through, under your body, extending it straight to the right side.
5. Simultaneously, drop your hips down toward the ground as you sit through, keeping your right knee bent.
6. Use your right hand and left foot to balance on the ground.
7. Return to the original high plank position by reversing the movement: retrace the extension of your left leg back underneath you, plant it back down, and replace your left hand on the ground.
8. Repeat the movement on the opposite side by lifting your right hand off the ground, pivoting on your left foot, and extending your right leg to the left side.
9. Maintain a smooth and controlled pace throughout the exercise, ensuring that your core remains engaged and your breathing is steady.
10. Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Full Sit Outs is a dynamic core and whole-body exercise that involves rotating and extending your legs through a sitting position while maintaining a strong plank posture.
